availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer. South Carolina native. Son of Peter Battou and Mary Adair Battou. Married to Elizabeth Tart Battou in 1816. Father of Kinchen Battoe and James Battoe, Jr. Farmer in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1820. Farmer in Trigg County in 1830. Owned one enslaved person in Trigg County in 1830. Farmer in Trigg County in 1840. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1840. Farmer in Trigg County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Trigg County in 1850. Farmer in Trigg County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Trigg County in 1860.
